body_html:
I have been trying to figure out how to do the go get directly, but I think that is not going to be possible.
What the Python libs are doing is placing the shared libraries inside the package, so we can't access them:

➜ ~/kaggle/state_farm sudo find / | grep tensorflow | grep -v avidales | grep "\.so"
/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/tensorflow/core/libtensorflow_framework.so
/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/tensorflow/python/_pywrap_tensorflow.so

And if we need to compile the libs, we are going to need to invoke in any way the bazel build //tensorflow:libtensorflow.so.
I can only see two possible options:

  1. Instead of using go get, use bazel to install the libraries. Bazel had added support for Go on the last versions, but this option will requiere to clone the repo and execute bazel manually.
  2. Use the go get || (go generate && go get) proposed initially. This is an ugly solution, but it works and is easy to execute.

@rakyll @tmc @vrv , Do you see any way to make this go-gettable?

And if we need to compile the libs, we are going to need to invoke in any way the bazel build //tensorflow:libtensorflow.so.
I can only see two possible options:

Instead of using go get, use bazel to install the libraries. Bazel had added support for Go on the last versions, but this option will requiere to clone the repo and execute bazel manually.
Use the go get || (go generate && go get) proposed initially. This is an ugly solution, but it works and is easy to execute.

@rakyll @tmc @vrv , Do you see any way to make this go-gettable?
body:
I have been trying to figure out how to do the `go get` directly, but I think that is not going to be possible.
What the Python libs are doing is placing the shared libraries inside the package, so we can't access them:

``` sh
➜ ~/kaggle/state_farm sudo find / | grep tensorflow | grep -v avidales | grep "\.so"
/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/tensorflow/core/libtensorflow_framework.so
/usr/local/lib/python2.7/dist-packages/tensorflow/python/_pywrap_tensorflow.so
```

And if we need to compile the libs, we are going to need to invoke in any way the `bazel build //tensorflow:libtensorflow.so`.
I can only see two possible options:
1. Instead of using `go get`, use bazel to install the libraries. Bazel had added support for Go on the last versions, but this option will requiere to clone the repo and execute bazel manually.
2. Use the `go get || (go generate && go get)` proposed initially. This is an ugly solution, but it works and is easy to execute.

@rakyll @tmc @vrv , Do you see any way to make this go-gettable?
